# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    result = ""
    for i in eachindex(text)
        if (i + 1) % text_width == 0 || text[i] == '.' || text[i] == '!' || text[i] == '?'
            result *= "\n"
        end
        result *= text[i]
    end
    return result
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello, world! This is a test. How are you? I'm fine. Thanks for asking.")
"Hello,\n world! This\n is a\n test. How\nare you? I'm\n fine. Thanks\nfor asking."
```
